mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an4.191:1.1.pli: “Sotānugatānaṁ, bhikkhave, dhammānaṁ, vacasā paricitānaṁ, manasānupekkhitānaṁ, diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhānaṁ cattāro ānisaṁsā pāṭikaṅkhā.
an4.191:1.1.en: “Mendicants, you can expect four benefits when the teachings have been followed by ear, rehearsed, examined by the mind, and well penetrated theoretically.

an4.191:1.5.pli: Tassa te dhammā sotānugatā honti, vacasā paricitā, manasānupekkhitā, diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā.
an4.191:1.5.en: They’ve followed those teachings by ear, rehearsed them, examined them by the mind, and well comprehended them theoretically.

an4.191:1.10.pli: Sotānugatānaṁ, bhikkhave, dhammānaṁ, vacasā paricitānaṁ, manasānupekkhitānaṁ, diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhānaṁ ayaṁ paṭhamo ānisaṁso pāṭikaṅkho.
an4.191:1.10.en: This is the first benefit you can expect when the teachings have been followed by ear, rehearsed, examined by the mind, and well penetrated theoretically.

an4.191:2.3.pli: Tassa te dhammā sotānugatā honti, vacasā paricitā, manasānupekkhitā, diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā.
an4.191:2.3.en: They’ve followed those teachings by ear, rehearsed them, examined them by the mind, and well comprehended them theoretically.

an4.191:2.26.pli: Sotānugatānaṁ, bhikkhave, dhammānaṁ, vacasā paricitānaṁ, manasānupekkhitānaṁ, diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhānaṁ ayaṁ dutiyo ānisaṁso pāṭikaṅkho.
an4.191:2.26.en: This is the second benefit you can expect when the teachings have been followed by ear, rehearsed, examined by the mind, and well penetrated theoretically.

an4.191:3.3.pli: Tassa te dhammā sotānugatā honti, vacasā paricitā, manasānupekkhitā, diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā.
an4.191:3.3.en: They’ve followed those teachings by ear, rehearsed them, examined them by the mind, and well comprehended them theoretically.

an4.191:3.26.pli: Sotānugatānaṁ, bhikkhave, dhammānaṁ, vacasā paricitānaṁ, manasānupekkhitānaṁ, diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhānaṁ ayaṁ tatiyo ānisaṁso pāṭikaṅkho.
an4.191:3.26.en: This is the third benefit you can expect when the teachings have been followed by ear, rehearsed, examined by the mind, and well penetrated theoretically.

an4.191:4.3.pli: Tassa te dhammā sotānugatā honti, vacasā paricitā, manasānupekkhitā, diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā.
an4.191:4.3.en: They’ve followed those teachings by ear, rehearsed them, examined them by the mind, and well comprehended them theoretically.

an4.191:4.29.pli: Sotānugatānaṁ, bhikkhave, dhammānaṁ, vacasā paricitānaṁ, manasānupekkhitānaṁ, diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhānaṁ ayaṁ catuttho ānisaṁso pāṭikaṅkho.
an4.191:4.29.en: This is the fourth benefit you can expect when the teachings have been followed by ear, rehearsed, examined by the mind, and well penetrated theoretically.

an4.191:4.30.pli: Sotānugatānaṁ, bhikkhave, dhammānaṁ, vacasā paricitānaṁ, manasānupekkhitānaṁ diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhānaṁ ime cattāro ānisaṁsā pāṭikaṅkhā”ti.
an4.191:4.30.en: You can expect these four benefits when the teachings have been followed by ear, rehearsed, examined by the mind, and well penetrated theoretically.”

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 4.191
20. The Great Chapter
Followed by Ear

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

mn49:11.1.pli: Pathaviṁ kho ahaṁ, brahme, pathavito abhiññāya yāvatā pathaviyā pathavattena ananubhūtaṁ tadabhiññāya pathaviṁ nāpahosiṁ, pathaviyā nāpahosiṁ, pathavito nāpahosiṁ, pathaviṁ meti nāpahosiṁ, pathaviṁ nābhivadiṁ.
mn49:11.1.en: Since directly knowing earth as earth, and since directly knowing that which does not fall within the scope of experience characterized by earth, I have not become earth, I have not become in earth, I have not become as earth, I have not become one who thinks ‘earth is mine’, I have not affirmed earth.

mn49:25.3.pli: Taṁ pathaviyā pathavattena ananubhūtaṁ, āpassa āpattena ananubhūtaṁ, tejassa tejattena ananubhūtaṁ, vāyassa vāyattena ananubhūtaṁ, bhūtānaṁ bhūtattena ananubhūtaṁ, devānaṁ devattena ananubhūtaṁ, pajāpatissa pajāpatittena ananubhūtaṁ, brahmānaṁ brahmattena ananubhūtaṁ, ābhassarānaṁ ābhassarattena ananubhūtaṁ, subhakiṇhānaṁ subhakiṇhattena ananubhūtaṁ, vehapphalānaṁ vehapphalattena ananubhūtaṁ, abhibhussa abhibhuttena ananubhūtaṁ, sabbassa sabbattena ananubhūtaṁ.
mn49:25.3.en: That is what does not fall within the scope of experience characterized by earth, water, fire, air, creatures, gods, the Progenitor, the Divinity, the gods of streaming radiance, the gods of universal beauty, the gods of abundant fruit, the Vanquisher, and the all.

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 49
On the Invitation of Divinity

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

sn35.65:2.2.pli: Atthi sotaṁ, atthi saddā, atthi sotaviññāṇaṁ, atthi sotaviññāṇaviññātabbā dhammā, atthi tattha māro vā mārapaññatti vā.
sn35.65:2.2.en: Where there is the ear, sounds, ear consciousness, and things knowable by ear consciousness, there is Māra or what is known as Māra.

7. With Migajāla
Samiddhi’s Question About Māra

mn98:9.6.en: not by ear nor by eye,
